attribute-definition.description: saves PayID for later referencing of paymorrow transaction
Stores a hashed string for comparing baskets, in order to check if the taxes need to be updated with a call to the Vertex tax calculation service.
A JSON object literal containing a map of LineItem's to their respective tax amounts.
This represents the UUID of the product line item that holds the qualifying product.
Renders an alternative URL in main navigation. Uses Commerce Cloud content url notation. For example: $url('Account-Show')$ or normal URL http://xchange.demandware.com

Used to define the content asset used to populate a grid page banner for a category. This value is applied to all sub-category navigation (cascading) if no specific catBannerID has been defined for a sub-category.
URL slug for SEO purposes.
Use this attribute to apply custom styles for this category.

Used to define if/when the Compare feature is to be visualized in the storefront based on navigation. If enableCompare = FALSE, no Compare checkboxes will be displayed in the grid view. If enableCompare = TRUE, the category (and its children) will support the Compare feature.
Which way to orient the menu and optional header menu HTML. Vertical will list all in one line. Horizontal will list in columns.

Used to indicate that a category (such as Mens -> Footwear -> Boots) will display in the roll-over navigation. A sub-category only shows if also the parent category is marked as showInMenu. Up to three category levels are shown in roll-over navigation.

Used to define the content asset ID of the Size Chart that is appropriate for products whose PRIMARY category is the associated category (and its children). Whenever a product detail page (or quick view) is rendered, the Size Chart link is populated based on the value of this attribute for the products primary categorization. If not defined, NO size chart link is displayed.
Image used on either the top or bottom slot on the category landing pages.
Content Generator Folder ID
Use this attribute to apply custom styles for this content asset.
The number of items returned by this customer
Email address.
Defines the house number
Used to store a PayPal billing agreement as a payment instrument in the users wallet.
Use this attribute to apply custom styles for this category.

value-definition.display: Can be combined with any promotion
Cannot be combined with promotions of same class
Cannot be combined with any promotion

attribute-definition.description: Used to map the shipment to a brick and mortar store.

attribute-definition.display-name: When this attribute equals 'instore', the checkout flow will assign the shipping method (005) which has a no shipping charge.

attribute-definition.description: This is text used by the end user when sending a message to the brick and mortar store about the shipment. This is reflected in the order export.
Estimated days until delivery

attribute-definition.display-name: List of Email Addresses for Notifications
attribute-definition.description: A list of email addresses to send notifications when errors occur during purchase post. Each address must conform to the RFC822 standard.
The basic authorization password credential is sent from OrderGroove in the header and must be validated and matched to process the request for recurring order placement.
The basic authorization username credential is sent from OrderGroove in the header and must be validated and matched to process the request for recurring order placement.

attribute-definition.display-name: Send OrderGroove the Order Billing Address
attribute-definition.description: Enables or disables the order billing address in the purchase post.

attribute-definition.display-name: Send OrderGroove the Order Payment Expiration
attribute-definition.description: Enables or disables the order payment card type in the purchase post. This is the expiration date of the first credit card payment instrument.

attribute-definition.display-name: Send OrderGroove the Order Payment Card Holder
attribute-definition.description: Enables or disables the order payment account holder in the purchase post. This is the account holder name of the first credit card payment instrument.

attribute-definition.display-name: Send OrderGroove the Order Payment Card Number
attribute-definition.description: Enables or disables the order payment account holder in the purchase post. This is the account number of the first credit card payment instrument.

attribute-definition.display-name: Send OrderGroove the Order Payment Card Type
attribute-definition.description: Enables or disables the order payment card type in the purchase post. This is the card type of the first credit card payment instrument.
The type of discount to apply to all auto delivery products in the cart based on the OrderGroove cookie.
The discount value amount based on the selected discount type to apply to all auto delivery products in the cart based on the OrderGroove cookie.
Enables or disables OrderGroove system emails during purchase post errors.
Enables or disables OrderGroove touchpoints.
Enables or disables the payment label in the purchase post. The label could be a custom field added to the payment object or simply the UUID of the payment used.
Key used to encode subscription information sent to OrderGroove and to decode order information from OrderGroove.
The OrderGroove merchant ID, provided by an OrderGroove client solutions partner.
The offer ID to be sent within the tracking override in the purchase post. This is only applicable in a custom implementation and supplied by OrderGroove.
Enables or disables the OrderGroove session ID (from cookie) in the purchase post.

attribute-definition.display-name: Send OrderGroove the Order Shipping Address
attribute-definition.description: Enables or disables the order's default shipping address in the purchase post.
Shipping method ID that will be used for all OrderGroove order placement calls.
Domain used for front-end script tags.
Enables or disables subscription data in the purchase post. This is only applicable in a custom implementation.

attribute-definition.display-name: Send OrderGroove the Order Payment Token
attribute-definition.description: Enables or disables the order payment token in the purchase post. The token may actually be the customer ID to access the customer profile wallet.
Enables or disables a tracking override in the purchase post. This is only applicable in a custom implementation.

attribute-definition.display-name: Payment Operator - Include MAC in Request
attribute-definition.description: When true the HMAC key is included with the request, otherwise it will be left out.

Use orderFeed as the base of the name, followed by an underscore and then your business name. If you have multiple Sites, please append an underscore and the Site Name to the file name. Example: orderFeed_MySite_SiteGenesis

Use productFeed as the base of the name, followed by an underscore and then your business name. If you have multiple Sites, please append an underscore and the Site Name to the file name. Example: productFeed_MySite_SiteGenesis
Turn on/off integration
Require registered customer to write reviews

attribute-definition.display-name: Custom Product Host (product export; no http)

attribute-definition.description: Semicolon separated list

Default country code for store searches

attribute-definition.display-name: Default Catalog ID For the site

attribute-definition.description: Disable Responsive Design for Storefront
This Boolean toggles the option for infinite scrolling or pagination from within the search grid.
The attribute is used to enable/disable Multi-Shipment Checkout for each site via BM.
This Boolean enables the storefront ability to perform tasks related to in store orders
Enable multiple shipments to different shipping addresses.
Enable address verification using the Smarty Streets web service API call.
Enable the collection of site issues into a JIRA system (not applicable on production)
The Group ID that holds KIND employees.
API Key to access LoginRadius
Message displayed when a user successfully updates their information.

attribute-definition.display-name: Enable debug logging for the LoginRadius service
attribute-definition.description: Enables INFO level log messages output to the custom log category 'loginradius' with call params and results for LoginRadius service.
Message displayed when an email is sent to a user
Callback that is called when email verification action is performed by user.
Message displayed when an email has been verified
Message displayed when an email is sent to a user to reset password
Site Key for Google Recaptcha
Enables/disables LoginRadius service on frontend.
Message displayed when a user has changed their password via the change password interface.
The Site Name passed to the LoginRadius API. This should be available in your LoginRadius settings.
When set to 'true', the user's profile will be updated on login. Otherwise the profile will only be updated upon initial account creation.
List of social login providers that are enabled for the site.
Marketing Cloud collect.js URL. The string MCMID must exist in the URL, for the marketing cloud MID to be inserted into the URL.
Default Marketing Cloud mailing lists to assign when customer subscribes. Please provide the numeric "List ID" value.
Select Yes to enable Marketing Cloud Analytics tracking. Requires Member ID to be set.

attribute-definition.display-name: Marketing Cloud Enable Mailing List Hooks
attribute-definition.description: Select Yes to enable Marketing Cloud mailing list functionality.
Select Yes to output Marketing Cloud Analytics tracking link into the storefront. Requires Member ID to be set.
Marketing Cloud Business Unit Member ID aka MID
Whitelist of Marketing Cloud mailing lists. If left empty, all lists are listed for customer. Please provide the numeric "List ID" value.

attribute-definition.display-name: Marketing Cloud Allow Unsubscribing from Lists over Deletion
attribute-definition.description: This flag will allow the Marketing Cloud cartridge to Unsubscribe users from assigned mailing lists, thus updating the subscriber's status from "Active" to "Unsubscribed". This will be used in place of fully deleting the record from the list.

If this is set, parameter Txtype is mandatory and will be sent along the order.
This is a mandatory if Paypal capture type is set to manual.
If "Yes" responses are processed also if they are unencrypted. This is for debugging reasons and should NOT be enabled on live systems.

If "Yes" the OrderDesc of the TransferObject will contain a String defined in paymentOperatorTestString instead of order data. This is needed for handling test data on Computop PaymentGate server side.
Should contain a string like this: Test:0000 where 0000 can be replaced with a different number (must be 4 digits long) which represents an error code.
Enable / disable usage of PPRO
This number indicates the number of times failures for Logins, GiftCert Balances, and Order Tracking requests will be allowed before displaying a CAPTCHA-style pop-up rate limiter

attribute-definition.display-name: Customer Export Last Modified Delay in Milliseconds
attribute-definition.description: Since the last modified date has to be written to a custom attribute, the business needs to identify a gap of time between the last tracked modified date and the modified date, where the last tracked modified date will not be updated. This is to prevent all customers ending up with a new last tracked modified date every time the job runs.

attribute-definition.display-name: Collect orders within the past X days

attribute-definition.description: Holds the IDs of any CustomerGroups that should be reported on the Order in the property custom.customerGroup

Used in finding the store near the ZIP code specified in the storefront by the end user.
Setting to switch between using 5 digit postal codes or 5+4 digit postal codes for the SmartyStreets address verification service's returned address results.
The company code field used to authorize API calls to the Vertex tax calculation service.
The default code used to calculate taxes for customers if they don't belong to one of the customer groups that will change their tax liability.
The default customer code for calls to the Vertex API.
The customer classes for assigning tax liability to different types of customer transactions.
The distribution center ID can be used for looking up the DC's address from the associated SFCC store object.
If the service is not enabled, then the fallback SFCC tax tables will be used for tax calculation purposes.
The number of benefits visible on a PDP before hiding the rest in an accordion.
